body:
As the title said... they have a deal to buy Mojang for $2,000,000,000. It is suspected to be done by the end of this week.


Here's the article on it: http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/09/09/microsoft-in-serious-discussions-to-purchase-minecraft-dev-mojang

replies.body:
All I know is that mojang is more secure when people try to scratch your account password (all migrated accounts are taken out)...

I know this from experience :P I decided to scratch minecraft account passwords, got 2, one of them changed the password, other one I can still get on if I like :P

replies.body:
Because it really needs saving? People who aren't focused on the PvP aspect of it (a.k.a. the other 2 / 3's of the community...) think it's fine, including myself.

But, honestly... I would take this news with a grain of salt.

The articles are stating that they want to buy Mojang for 2 billion dollars, and it is quite insane to believe that Mojang is worth 2 billion dollars... And what benefit would Microsoft even have from obtaining Mojang? They now have a rag-tag team of developers, and a game that has already been out for years? Sure Minecraft still has lots of life left to go, but not worth 2 billion dollars kind of life.

In addition, I do not believe that Notch would be driven by monetary reasons. He's been quoted saying that "he has more money now than he could ever spend." In fact, I have a friend that watched him say that in an interview with Craig Ferguson.

It'll be worth keeping an eye on, but until Mojang makes statements, I wouldn't believe any of it actually happening.
replies.body_tagged:

But, honestly... I would take this news with a grain of salt.

The articles are stating that they want to buy Mojang for 2 billion dollars, and it is quite insane to believe that Mojang is worth 2 billion dollars... And what benefit would Microsoft even have from obtaining Mojang? They now have a rag-tag team of developers, and a game that has already been out for years? Sure Minecraft still has lots of life left to go, but not worth 2 billion dollars kind of life.

In addition, I do not believe that Notch would be driven by monetary reasons. He's been quoted saying that "he has more money now than he could ever spend." In fact, I have a friend that watched him say that in an interview with Craig Ferguson.

It'll be worth keeping an eye on, but until Mojang makes statements, I wouldn't believe any of it actually happening.
